original_title: Sri Lanka govt to increase fuel quota from midnight – PMD
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Sri Lankan government will increase fuel quota for motorists from Tuesday midnight as the island nation has necessary fuel stocks, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.
“The existing fuel quota has been increased for the New Year festive season and will come into effect from midnight today,” the PMD said in a statement on Tuesday (04).
“As previously planned, according to the increasing need for the festive season, the CPC has ordered & received the necessary fuel stocks.”
Sri Lanka introduced the quota system in August last year to limit the fuel consumption as it ran out of petrol and diesel due to foreign currency shortage.

The government declaration of sovereign debt default also deprived the state-run fuel retailer Ceypetco of receiving fuel on credit as many foreign banks refused to open corresponding Letter of Credit.
However, the government had been expecting the tight situation to ease after the International Monetary Fund (IMF) approved a $3 billion loan last month. (Colombo/April04/2023)
